description:
When life becomes too much for Mirai to bear and attempts taking his own life, he’s saved by Nasse, a guardian angel who offers him a chance at becoming the new god. To do so, he must face off against 12 other candidates within 999 days. Mirai, who was once at rock bottom, now finds himself with supernatural powers in a battle royale for the highest title.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/177404788)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
Originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

Tsugumi Ooba is a fictional writer credited with writing the manga Death Note. Their real identity (and gender) is a closely guarded secret

Day and night, develops manga plots while holding knees on a chair (reminiscent of one of the main characters in Death Note, L.)

They like to collect teacups.

(Source: VIZ Media)

[Twitter](https://x.com/T_Obata_info) | [Twitter (Old)](https://twitter.com/obata_ten)

Takeshi Obata is a Japanese manga artist that usually works as the illustrator in collaboration with a writer. He first gained international attention for [Hikaru no Go](https://anilist.co/manga/30020/Hikaru-no-Go/) (1998–2003) with [Yumi Hotta](https://anilist.co/staff/96889/Yumi-Hotta), but is better known for [Death Note](https://anilist.co/manga/30021/Death-Note/) (2003–2006) and [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/manga/39711/Bakuman/) (2008–2012) with [Tsugumi Ohba](https://anilist.co/staff/97111/Tsugumi-Ohba). Obata has mentored several well-known manga artists, including [Nobuhiro Watsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96890/Nobuhiro-Watsuki) of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/manga/30022/Rurouni-Kenshin-Meiji-Kenkaku-Romantan/) fame, [Black Cat](https://anilist.co/manga/30040/Black-Cat/) creator [Kentaro Yabuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96900/Kentarou-Yabuki), and [Eyeshield 21](https://anilist.co/manga/30043/Eyeshield-21/) artist [Yusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903/Yusuke-Murata).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/猪爪慎一)
Affiliated with KUSANAGI.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yusuke_Editor)

**[Profile (ONEMUSIC)](http://one-music.jp/tokuda/index.html)**

Masahiro Tokuda is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and guitarist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He grew up admiring anime such as [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/) an during highschool he started animating with his friends. He enrolled into a professional animation school after graduating but quit quickly due to being disappointed in how the lessons were conducted.

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).

After working on [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/)'s [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1095/) he permanently joined Production I.G. becoming known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.

__[Website](https://bandmaid.tokyo/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bandmaid)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/bandmaid/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bandmaid.jp/)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ Rock (Hard Rock), Metal (Heavy Metal)

__Introduction:__
Band-Maid, stylized as BAND-MAID and formerly as BAND-MAID®, is a five-piece, all-female Japanese rock group, signed to Gump Records, an imprint of the Shibuya-based Platinum Passport artist management and talent agency, itself a division of Avex Group.

__Biography:__
Since their formation, Band-Maid has regularly performed live at various venues around the Tokyo area. The group released their debut mini-album "MAID IN JAPAN" in January 2014. Later this year, the band released their single Ai to Jōnetsu no Matador ("Love, Passion, Matador" internationally) and in November 2015 their second mini-album "New Beginning" followed. In May 2016 Band-Maid released their third mini-album (and first major label album) "Brand New Maid" and in October and November the band went on their first tour which took them to Mexico, Hong Kong, and six countries in Europe. In January 2017 Band-Maid released their first full-length album "Just Bring It"

__Members:__
[Miku Kobato](https://anilist.co/staff/204236) (小鳩ミク) – rhythm guitar, backing vocals, occasional lead vocals (2013–)
[Kanami Tōno](https://anilist.co/staff/362158/Kanami-Toono) (遠乃歌波) – lead guitar, backing vocals (2013–)
[Akane Hirose](https://anilist.co/staff/362159/Akane-Hirose) (廣瀬茜) – drums, backing vocals (2013–)
[Misa](https://anilist.co/staff/362160/MISA) (ミサ, stylized as MISA) – bass (2013–)
[Saiki Atsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/346854/SAIKI) (厚見彩姫) – lead and backing vocals (2013–)

[Official Website](http://yuu-miyashita.com/) | [NicoNico](http://www.nicovideo.jp/user/4840929) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/miyyuu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miy_yuu) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/info_miyako) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/4143952)

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kuvshinov_Ilya) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=789222) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [ArtStation](https://www.artstation.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/kuvshinov-ilya) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KuvshinovIlia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Mad1Artist) | [Vimeo](https://vimeo.com/kuvshinovilya) | [Tumblr](http://kuvshinov-ilya.tumblr.com/)

Ilya Kuvshinov is a Russian born animator, illustrator and designer.

__[Yasuda's Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e5%ae%89%e7%94%b0%e6%82%a0%e5%9f%bakanadeyuk) | [Twitter (Yasuda)](https://twitter.com/YUK_kanade) | [Utatane's Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%81%86%e3%81%9f%e3%81%9f%e3%81%ad%e6%ad%8c%e8%8f%9ckanadeyuk) | [Twitter (Utatane)](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)__ Introduction KanadeYUK is a two-piece collaboration between Yasuda Yuki and Utatane Kana who are both Japanese songwriters and arrangers. They are affiliated with TaWaRa Inc. Members: Yuuki Yasuda（安田悠基） Birthplace: Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture Roles: Lyrics, arrangement and mainly band sounds/digital sounds Kana Utatane（うたたね歌菜） Date of Birth: May 13, 1994 Birthplace: Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture Roles: Composition, arrangement, mainly strings, piano and orchestration (Source: ja.wikipedia.org)

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/hotaru) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hotar_)__ __hotaru__ is a Japanese lyricist and story planner for the band MYTH & ROID. He is affiliated with TaWaRa Inc.

[Official Website](https://www.birte-baumgardt.de/) | [Synchronkartei](https://www.synchronkartei.de/sprecher/3385/2) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbsynx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/synxtress/)

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/tavo.campos.92)

A Mexican audio engineer who sometimes works as an ADR Director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/erickbglx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/erickbglx/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/ErickDublou)

Erick Bougleux is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/leonardosanthos) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/leonardosanthos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/leonardosanthos) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@FalaCritica) | [Twitch](http://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica)

Leonardo Santhos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem / Kog'Maw, The Mouth of the Abyss / Vel'Koz, the Eye of the Void / Wukong, the Monkey King (League of Legends)
- Pierce Wheels (Ben 10: Alien Force)
- Peter "Pete" Devin / Master Carter (BONDiNG)
- Agent Bratcher (Outer Banks)
- Henrich Zemo / Baron Zemo (1st voice; The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes)
- Soren (The Dragon Prince)
- Myst (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Spartan Jared Miller (Halo 4)
- Tetsuya Fukazawa (Ju-On: Origins)
- Kyd Miller (1st voice - 10th season; The X-Files)
- Onix (Gears of War: Judgement)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).
